When you don't want to shop, eat or drink in your local area because of the gas and smell from #WalleysQuarry, but you want to support your local businesses #dilemma #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @NewsNBC @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA

@SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @RomanGeezer @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix Photo scoop! Thames Water team arrived while I was at Shortlands sewer this afternoon. They'd traced the culprit in the adjacent industrial estate & served a notice. The green dye is their tracer. They began the cleanup (worker photo with permission). https://t.co/mvMsIjnQqF

tweets.text: A gentle reminder that drones and remote vehicles can not be flown over Sites of Special Scientific Interest (marked in red) without NE and landowner consent, as it can be dangerous for wildlife and cause disturbance. Thanks for protecting the estuary and east devon heaths üôÇ https://t.co/JwK12yLr7R
@Bigdwazda @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @UKParliament @PersimmonHomes might be interested in this.

@Bigdwazda @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @UKParliament I live 2 miles from the Landfill in Newcastle town centre and the stench is disgusting, it gets inside our home despite windows & doors being firmly shut. Bad management of the Landfill is the cause of odour, EA need to get grip of the situation before something drastic happens

Those houses seem very close to a landfill don‚Äôt they. Especially one that‚Äôs as badly managed as Walleys Quarry.  

Housing companies wouldn‚Äôt make the mistake of building more right next to it would they?
